Reporting graphical comparison procedures in GSD studies

appendMCP.Rd

appendMCP provides routines for describing graphical multiple comparison procedures (MCP) in group sequential design (GSD) studies. The objective is to generate an R Markdown file that defines the MTP and interim analyses, which can be appended to a statistical analysis plan document.

Details

The package provides predefined templates that can be modified by a user, ideally by changing only high-level input parameters.

To load a template in Rstudio, use "File" -> "New File" -> "R Markdown ..." Select "From Template" (left panel), then choose "MCP in GSD"

See also

Useful links:

  • https://ytymofyeyev.github.io/appendMCP/

Author

Maintainer: Yevgen Tymofyeyev ytymofye@its.jnj.com

Authors:

  • Michael Grayling mgraylin@its.jnj.com

Examples

# Load template from command line:
# rmarkdown::draft("my_report", template = "mcpgen", package = "appendMCP", edit = FALSE)
# To open created file in Rstudio editor use
# rstudioapi::navigateToFile("my_report/my_report.Rmd")
